tools.name: Modify email labels
tools.description: Adds and/or removes specified Gmail labels for a message; ensure `message_id` and all `label_ids` are valid (use 'listLabels' for custom label IDs).

add_label_ids.description: Label IDs to add. For custom labels, obtain IDs via 'listLabels'. System labels (e.g., 'INBOX', 'SPAM', 'STARRED', 'IMPORTANT') can be used, but immutable system labels like 'DRAFT' and 'SENT' cannot be added or removed.
add_label_ids.title: Add Label Ids

message_id.description: Immutable ID of the message to modify (e.g., from 'fetchEmails' or 'fetchMessagesByThreadId').
message_id.title: Message Id

remove_label_ids.description: Label IDs to remove. For custom labels, obtain IDs via 'listLabels'. System labels can be used, but immutable system labels like 'DRAFT' and 'SENT' cannot be added or removed via messages.modify.
remove_label_ids.title: Remove Label Ids

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.
historyId.title: History Id

id.description: The immutable ID of the sent message.
id.title: Id

internalDate.description: The internal timestamp of the message in milliseconds since epoch.
internalDate.title: Internal Date

labelIds.description: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.
labelIds.title: Label Ids

payload.description: The parsed email structure, including headers and body parts.
payload.title: Payload

raw.description: The entire email message in RFC 2822 format, base64url-encoded.
raw.title: Raw

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size of the message in bytes.
sizeEstimate.title: Size Estimate

snippet.description: A short extract of the message text.
snippet.title: Snippet

threadId.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.
threadId.title: Thread Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Batch delete Gmail messages
tools.description: Tool to permanently delete multiple Gmail messages in bulk. Use when you need to efficiently remove large numbers of emails (e.g., retention enforcement, mailbox hygiene).

ids.description: List of message IDs to delete. Obtain IDs via list or fetch actions.
ids.title: Ids

userId.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
userId.title: User Id

inputParameters.title: BatchDeleteMessagesRequest
inputParameters.description: Request model for bulk deletion of Gmail messages by ID.

success.description: Whether the bulk deletion was successful
success.title: Success

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Batch modify Gmail messages
tools.description: Modify labels on multiple Gmail messages in one efficient API call. Supports up to 1,000 messages per request for bulk operations like archiving, marking as read/unread, or applying custom labels.

addLabelIds.description: List of label IDs to add to the messages. Common label IDs: INBOX, STARRED, IMPORTANT, SENT, DRAFT, SPAM, TRASH, UNREAD. Use GMAIL_LIST_LABELS to get custom label IDs. Leave empty to skip adding labels.
addLabelIds.title: Add Label Ids

messageIds.description: List of message IDs to modify. Maximum 1,000 message IDs per request. Get message IDs from GMAIL_FETCH_EMAILS or GMAIL_LIST_THREADS actions.
messageIds.title: Message Ids

removeLabelIds.description: List of label IDs to remove from the messages. Common use cases: Remove 'UNREAD' to mark as read, remove 'INBOX' to archive, remove 'SPAM' to unmark spam. Leave empty to skip removing labels.
removeLabelIds.title: Remove Label Ids

userId.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
userId.title: User Id

success.description: Whether the batch modification was successful
success.title: Success

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Create email draft
tools.description: Creates a Gmail email draft, requiring at least one of recipient_email, cc, or bcc must be provided. Atleast one of subject or body must be provided. Supports To/Cc/Bcc, subject, plain/HTML body (ensure `is_html=True` for HTML), attachments, and threading. When creating a draft reply to an existing thread (thread_id provided), leave subject empty to stay in the same thread; setting a subject will create a NEW thread instead.

attachment.title: FileUploadable
attachment.description: File to attach to the email.

bcc.description: Blind Carbon Copy (BCC) recipients' email addresses. Atleast one of cc, bcc, or recipient_email must be provided.
bcc.title: Bcc

body.description: Email body content (plain text or HTML); `is_html` must be True if HTML. Either subject or body must be provided.
body.title: Body
examples:
Hello Team,

Please find the attached report for your review.

Best regards,
Your Name

Meeting Confirmation

This email confirms our meeting scheduled for next Tuesday.

cc.description: Carbon Copy (CC) recipients' email addresses. Atleast one of cc, bcc, or recipient_email must be provided.
cc.title: Cc

extra_recipients.description: Additional 'To' recipients' email addresses (not Cc or Bcc). Should only be used if recipient_email is also provided.
extra_recipients.title: Extra Recipients

is_html.description: Set to True if `body` is HTML, otherwise the action may fail.
is_html.title: Is Html

recipient_email.description: Primary recipient's email address. Required if cc and bcc is not provided, else can be optional. Use extra_recipients if you want to send to multiple recipients.
recipient_email.title: Recipient Email

subject.description: Email subject line. Either subject or body must be provided. When creating a draft reply to an existing thread (thread_id provided), leave this empty to stay in the same thread. Setting a subject will create a NEW thread instead.
subject.title: Subject

thread_id.description: ID of an existing Gmail thread to reply to; omit for new thread.
thread_id.title: Thread Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

id.description: Immutable ID of the draft.
id.title: Id

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.
historyId.title: History Id

id.description: The immutable ID of the sent message.
id.title: Id

internalDate.description: The internal timestamp of the message in milliseconds since epoch.
internalDate.title: Internal Date

labelIds.description: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.
labelIds.title: Label Ids

payload.description: The parsed email structure, including headers and body parts.
payload.title: Payload

raw.description: The entire email message in RFC 2822 format, base64url-encoded.
raw.title: Raw

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size of the message in bytes.
sizeEstimate.title: Size Estimate

snippet.description: A short extract of the message text.
snippet.title: Snippet

threadId.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.
threadId.title: Thread Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Create label
tools.description: Creates a new label with a unique name in the specified user's Gmail account.

background_color.description: Background color for the label. Must be selected from Gmail's predefined color palette of over 100 colors (not arbitrary hex values). If setting a color, both background_color and text_color must be provided. See the official Color field documentation for the full palette: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/reference/rest/v1/users.labels#Color
background_color.title: GmailLabelColor

label_list_visibility.description: Controls how the label is displayed in the label list in the Gmail sidebar.
label_list_visibility.title: Label List Visibility

label_name.description: The name for the new label. Must be unique within the account, non-blank, maximum length 225 characters, cannot contain ',', '/', or '.' (period), not only whitespace, and must not be a reserved system label (e.g., INBOX, SENT, DRAFT, SPAM, TRASH, ALL_MAIL, CATEGORY_*).
label_name.title: Label Name

message_list_visibility.description: Controls how messages with this label are displayed in the message list.
message_list_visibility.title: Message List Visibility

text_color.description: Text color for the label. Must be selected from Gmail's predefined color palette of over 100 colors (not arbitrary hex values). If setting a color, both text_color and background_color must be provided. See the official Color field documentation for the full palette: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/reference/rest/v1/users.labels#Color
text_color.title: GmailLabelColor

user_id.description: The email address of the user in whose account the label will be created.
user_id.title: User Id

color.description: Optional color settings for the label.
color.title: LabelColor

backgroundColor.description: Hex code for the background color of the label.
backgroundColor.title: Background Color

textColor.description: Hex code for the text color of the label.
textColor.title: Text Color

id.description: The immutable ID of the label.
id.title: Id

labelListVisibility.description: Visibility of the label in the label list (e.g., 'labelShow' or 'labelHide').
labelListVisibility.title: Label List Visibility

messageListVisibility.description: Visibility of messages with the label in the message list (e.g., 'show' or 'hide').
messageListVisibility.title: Message List Visibility

name.description: The display name of the label.
name.title: Name

type.description: The type of label (system or user).
type.title: Type

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Delete Draft
tools.description: Permanently deletes a specific Gmail draft using its ID; ensure the draft exists and the user has necessary permissions for the given `user_id`.

draft_id.description: Immutable ID of the draft to delete, typically obtained when the draft was created.
draft_id.title: Draft Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user; 'me' is recommended.
user_id.title: User Id

success.description: Indicates whether the draft was successfully deleted.
success.title: Success

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Delete message
tools.description: Permanently deletes a specific email message by its ID from a Gmail mailbox; for `user_id`, use 'me' for the authenticated user or an email address to which the authenticated user has delegated access.

message_id.description: Identifier of the email message to delete.
message_id.title: Message Id

user_id.description: User's email address. The special value 'me' refers to the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

success.description: Indicates whether the Gmail message deletion was successful
success.title: Success

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Fetch emails
tools.description: Fetches a list of email messages from a Gmail account, supporting filtering, pagination, and optional full content retrieval.

ids_only.description: If true, only returns message IDs from the list API without fetching individual message details. Fastest option for getting just message IDs and thread IDs.
ids_only.title: Ids Only

include_payload.description: Set to true to include full message payload (headers, body, attachments); false for metadata only.
include_payload.title: Include Payload

include_spam_trash.description: Set to true to include messages from 'SPAM' and 'TRASH'.
include_spam_trash.title: Include Spam Trash

label_ids.description: Filter by label IDs; only messages with all specified labels are returned. Common IDs: 'INBOX', 'SPAM', 'TRASH', 'UNREAD', 'STARRED', 'IMPORTANT', 'CATEGORY_PRIMARY' (alias 'CATEGORY_PERSONAL'), 'CATEGORY_SOCIAL', 'CATEGORY_PROMOTIONS', 'CATEGORY_UPDATES', 'CATEGORY_FORUMS'. Use 'listLabels' action for custom IDs.
label_ids.title: Label Ids

max_results.description: Maximum number of messages to retrieve per page.
max_results.title: Max Results

page_token.description: Token for retrieving a specific page, obtained from a previous response's `nextPageToken`. Omit for the first page.
page_token.title: Page Token

query.description: Gmail advanced search query (e.g., 'from:user subject:meeting'). Supports operators like 'from:', 'to:', 'subject:', 'label:', 'has:attachment', 'is:unread', 'after:YYYY/MM/DD', 'before:YYYY/MM/DD', AND/OR/NOT. Use quotes for exact phrases. Omit for no query filter.
query.title: Query

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

verbose.description: If false, uses optimized concurrent metadata fetching for faster performance (~75% improvement). If true, uses standard detailed message fetching. When false, only essential fields (subject, sender, recipient, time, labels) are guaranteed.
verbose.title: Verbose

messages.description: List of retrieved email messages. Includes full content if `include_payload` was true, otherwise metadata.
messages.title: Messages

items.description: This model represents the body a Gmail message.
items.title: MessageBody

labelIds.description: The label IDs of the message
labelIds.title: Label Ids

messageId.description: The message ID of the message
messageId.title: Message Id

threadId.description: The thread ID of the message
threadId.title: Thread Id

nextPageToken.description: Token for the next page of results; use in subsequent `page_token` request. Empty if no more results.
nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token

resultSizeEstimate.description: Estimated total messages matching the query (not just this page).
resultSizeEstimate.title: Result Size Estimate

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Fetch message by message ID
tools.description: Fetches a specific email message by its ID, provided the `message_id` exists and is accessible to the authenticated `user_id`.

format.description: Format for message content: 'minimal' (ID/labels), 'full' (complete data), 'raw' (base64url string), 'metadata' (ID/labels/headers).
format.title: Format

message_id.description: Unique ID of the email message to retrieve, obtainable from actions like 'List Messages'.
message_id.title: Message Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

labelIds.description: The label IDs of the message
labelIds.title: Label Ids

messageId.description: The message ID of the message
messageId.title: Message Id

threadId.description: The thread ID of the message
threadId.title: Thread Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Fetch Message by Thread ID

thread_id.description: Unique ID of the thread, obtainable from actions like 'listThreads' or 'fetchEmails'.

tools.name: Get Gmail attachment
tools.description: Retrieves a specific attachment by ID from a message in a user's Gmail mailbox, requiring valid message and attachment IDs.

attachment_id.description: ID of the attachment to retrieve. Make sure that attachment_id is passed and is valid, not a placeholder or NULL.
attachment_id.title: Attachment Id

file_name.description: Desired filename for the downloaded attachment. Make sure that file_name is passed
file_name.title: File Name

message_id.description: Immutable ID of the message containing the attachment. Make sure that message_id is passed and is valid, not a placeholder or NULL.
message_id.title: Message Id

user_id.description: User's email address ('me' for authenticated user).
user_id.title: User Id

file.description: Object containing metadata and URL for the retrieved attachment.
file.title: File

s3url.description: S3 URL of the downloaded file.
s3url.title: S3Url

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Get contacts
tools.description: Fetches contacts (connections) for the authenticated Google account, allowing selection of specific data fields and pagination.

include_other_contacts.description: Include 'Other Contacts' (interacted with but not explicitly saved) in addition to regular contacts; if true, fetches from both endpoints and merges results.
include_other_contacts.title: Include Other Contacts

page_token.description: Token to retrieve a specific page of results, obtained from 'nextPageToken' in a previous response.
page_token.title: Page Token

person_fields.description: Comma-separated person fields to retrieve for each contact (e.g., 'names,emailAddresses').
person_fields.title: Person Fields

resource_name.description: Identifier for the person resource whose connections are listed; use 'people/me' for the authenticated user.
resource_name.title: Resource Name

emailAddresses.description: List of the contact's email addresses
emailAddresses.title: Email Addresses

items.description: An email address record for a contact.
items.title: EmailAddress

primary.description: Whether this field is marked as primary
primary.title: Primary

id.description: Identifier of the source record
id.title: Id

sourcePrimary.description: Whether this source is the primary source for the field
sourcePrimary.title: Source Primary

items.description: A name record for a contact.
items.title: Name

displayNameLastFirst.description: Display name formatted as Last, First
displayNameLastFirst.title: Display Name Last First

primary.description: Whether this field is marked as primary
primary.title: Primary

id.description: Identifier of the source record
id.title: Id

sourcePrimary.description: Whether this source is the primary source for the field
sourcePrimary.title: Source Primary

resourceName.description: Unique resource identifier for the contact
resourceName.title: Resource Name

totalPeople.description: Total number of distinct people returned
totalPeople.title: Total People

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Get People
tools.description: Retrieves either a specific person's details (using `resource_name`) or lists 'Other Contacts' (if `other_contacts` is true), with `person_fields` specifying the data to return.

other_contacts.description: If true, retrieves 'Other Contacts' (people interacted with but not explicitly saved), ignoring `resource_name` and enabling pagination/sync. If false, retrieves information for the single person specified by `resource_name`.
other_contacts.title: Other Contacts

page_size.description: The number of 'Other Contacts' to return per page. Applicable only when `other_contacts` is true.
page_size.title: Page Size

page_token.description: An opaque token from a previous response to retrieve the next page of 'Other Contacts' results. Applicable only when `other_contacts` is true and paginating.
page_token.title: Page Token

person_fields.description: A comma-separated field mask to restrict which fields on the person (or persons) are returned. Consult the Google People API documentation for a comprehensive list of valid fields.
person_fields.title: Person Fields

resource_name.description: Resource name identifying the person for whom to retrieve information (like the authenticated user or a specific contact). Used only when `other_contacts` is false.
resource_name.title: Resource Name

sync_token.description: A token from a previous 'Other Contacts' list call to retrieve only changes since the last sync; leave empty for an initial full sync. Applicable only when `other_contacts` is true.
sync_token.title: Sync Token

other_contacts.description: Contains the list of 'Other Contacts', potentially including tokens for pagination or future syncs. Populated when `other_contacts` is true.
other_contacts.title: Other Contacts

people_data.description: Contains the person's data as requested, populated when `other_contacts` is false and a single person is fetched.
people_data.title: People Data

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Get Profile
tools.description: Retrieves key Gmail profile information (email address, message/thread totals, history ID) for a user.

user_id.description: The email address of the Gmail user whose profile is to be retrieved, or the special value 'me' to indicate the currently authenticated user.

historyId.description: The ID of the mailbox's current history record.
historyId.title: History Id

messagesTotal.description: The total number of messages in the mailbox.

threadsTotal.description: The total number of threads in the mailbox.
threadsTotal.title: Threads Total

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

page_token.description: Token from a previous response to retrieve a specific page of drafts.

verbose.description: If true, fetches full draft details including subject, sender, recipient, body, and timestamp. If false, returns only draft IDs (faster).

tools.name: List Gmail history
tools.description: Tool to list Gmail mailbox change history since a known startHistoryId. Use when performing incremental mailbox syncs to fetch only new changes.

history_types.description: Filter by specific history types. Allowed values: messageAdded, messageDeleted, labelAdded, labelRemoved.

label_id.description: Only return history records involving messages with this label ID.

max_results.description: Maximum number of history records to return. Default is 100; max is 500.

page_token.description: Token to retrieve a specific page of results.

start_history_id.description: Required. Returns history records after this ID. If the ID is invalid or too old, the API returns 404. Perform a full sync in that case.

tools.name: List Gmail labels
tools.description: Retrieves a list of all system and user-created labels for the specified Gmail account.

user_id.description: Identifies the Gmail account (owner's email or 'me' for authenticated user) for which labels will be listed.
user_id.title: User Id

labels.description: A list of label objects in the user's mailbox.
labels.title: Labels

color.description: Optional color settings for the label.
color.title: LabelColor

backgroundColor.description: Hex code for the background color of the label.
backgroundColor.title: Background Color

textColor.description: Hex code for the text color of the label.
textColor.title: Text Color

id.description: The immutable ID of the label.
id.title: Id

labelListVisibility.description: Visibility of the label in the label list (e.g., 'labelShow' or 'labelHide').
labelListVisibility.title: Label List Visibility

messageListVisibility.description: Visibility of messages with the label in the message list (e.g., 'show' or 'hide').
messageListVisibility.title: Message List Visibility

name.description: The display name of the label.
name.title: Name

type.description: The type of label (system or user).
type.title: Type

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: List threads
tools.description: Retrieves a list of email threads from a Gmail account, identified by `user_id` (email address or 'me'), supporting filtering and pagination.

max_results.description: Maximum number of threads to return.
max_results.title: Max Results

page_token.description: Token from a previous response to retrieve a specific page of results; omit for the first page.
page_token.title: Page Token

query.description: Filter for threads, using Gmail search query syntax (e.g., 'from:user@example.com is:unread').
query.title: Query

user_id.description: The user's email address or 'me' to specify the authenticated Gmail account.
user_id.title: User Id

verbose.description: If false, returns threads with basic fields (id, snippet, historyId). If true, returns threads with complete message details including headers, body, attachments, and metadata for each message in the thread.
verbose.title: Verbose

nextPageToken.description: Token for the next page of results; if present, use as page_token in a subsequent request to fetch more threads.
nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token

threads.description: List of email thread resources, each containing id, historyId, and snippet.
threads.title: Threads

items.description: Represents a Gmail thread with basic metadata.
items.title: Thread

historyId.description: ID of the last history record for the thread.
historyId.title: History Id

id.description: Unique identifier of the thread.
id.title: Id

snippet.description: A short preview of the thread's message content.
snippet.title: Snippet

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Modify thread labels
tools.description: Adds or removes specified existing label IDs from a Gmail thread, affecting all its messages; ensure the thread ID is valid.

add_label_ids.description: List of label IDs to add to the thread; these labels must exist.
add_label_ids.title: Add Label Ids

remove_label_ids.description: List of label IDs to remove from the thread; these labels must exist.
remove_label_ids.title: Remove Label Ids

thread_id.description: Immutable ID of the thread to modify.
thread_id.title: Thread Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

response.description: Details of the thread after label modification
response.title: Response

historyId.description: The history identifier for the thread update, if provided
historyId.title: History Id

id.description: The unique identifier of the thread
id.title: Id

messages.description: Array of messages in the thread with updated label information
messages.title: Messages

items.description:
Standard Gmail message response returned by Gmail API for sent messages.
Used by actions like send_email and send_draft.
items.title: GmailMessageResponse

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.
historyId.title: History Id

id.description: The immutable ID of the sent message.
id.title: Id

internalDate.description: The internal timestamp of the message in milliseconds since epoch.
internalDate.title: Internal Date

labelIds.description: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.
labelIds.title: Label Ids

payload.description: The parsed email structure, including headers and body parts.
payload.title: Payload

raw.description: The entire email message in RFC 2822 format, base64url-encoded.
raw.title: Raw

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size of the message in bytes.
sizeEstimate.title: Size Estimate

snippet.description: A short extract of the message text.
snippet.title: Snippet

threadId.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.
threadId.title: Thread Id

success.description: Indicates whether the labels were successfully modified on the thread.
success.title: Success

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Move to Trash
tools.description: Moves an existing, non-deleted email message to the trash for the specified user.

message_id.description: Identifier of the email message to move to trash.
message_id.title: Message Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.
historyId.title: History Id

id.description: The immutable ID of the sent message.
id.title: Id

internalDate.description: The internal timestamp of the message in milliseconds since epoch.
internalDate.title: Internal Date

labelIds.description: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.
labelIds.title: Label Ids

payload.description: The parsed email structure, including headers and body parts.
payload.title: Payload

raw.description: The entire email message in RFC 2822 format, base64url-encoded.
raw.title: Raw

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size of the message in bytes.
sizeEstimate.title: Size Estimate

snippet.description: A short extract of the message text.
snippet.title: Snippet

threadId.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.
threadId.title: Thread Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Patch Label
tools.description: Patches the specified label.

color.description: The color to assign to the label. Color is only available for labels that have their `type` set to `user`.
color.title: PatchLabelColor

backgroundColor.description: The background color of the label, represented as a hex string. Must be one of Gmail's predefined colors from the color palette. See: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/guides/labels#color_palette
backgroundColor.title: Background Color

textColor.description: The text color of the label, represented as a hex string. Must be one of Gmail's predefined colors from the color palette. See: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/guides/labels#color_palette
textColor.title: Text Color

id.description: The ID of the label to update.
id.title: Id

labelListVisibility.description: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface.
labelListVisibility.title: Label List Visibility

messageListVisibility.description: The visibility of messages with this label in the message list in the Gmail web interface.
messageListVisibility.title: Message List Visibility

name.description: The display name of the label.
name.title: Name

userId.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
userId.title: User Id

color.description: The color representation for the label.
color.title: PatchLabelColor

backgroundColor.description: The background color of the label, represented as a hex string. Must be one of Gmail's predefined colors from the color palette. See: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/guides/labels#color_palette
backgroundColor.title: Background Color

textColor.description: The text color of the label, represented as a hex string. Must be one of Gmail's predefined colors from the color palette. See: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/guides/labels#color_palette
textColor.title: Text Color

id.description: The immutable ID of the label.
id.title: Id

labelListVisibility.description: Visibility of the label in the Gmail web interface label list.
labelListVisibility.title: Label List Visibility

messageListVisibility.description: Visibility of messages under this label in the Gmail web interface message list.
messageListVisibility.title: Message List Visibility

messagesTotal.description: The total number of messages with this label.
messagesTotal.title: Messages Total

messagesUnread.description: The number of unread messages with this label.
messagesUnread.title: Messages Unread

name.description: The display name of the label.
name.title: Name

threadsTotal.description: The total number of threads with this label.
threadsTotal.title: Threads Total

threadsUnread.description: The number of unread threads with this label.
threadsUnread.title: Threads Unread

type.description: The owner type of the label. Allowed values: 'system', 'user'.
type.title: Type

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Remove label
tools.description: Permanently deletes a specific, existing user-created Gmail label by its ID for a user; cannot delete system labels.

label_id.description: ID of the user-created label to be permanently deleted; must exist and not be a system label.
label_id.title: Label Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

success.description: True if the label deletion was successful (e.g., API returned 204 status).
success.title: Success

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Reply to email thread
tools.description: Sends a reply within a specific Gmail thread using the original thread's subject, requiring a valid `thread_id` and at least one of recipient_email, cc, or bcc must be provided. Supports attachments via the `attachment` parameter with valid `s3key`, `mimetype`, and `name`.

attachment.title: FileUploadable
attachment.description: File to attach to the reply. Just Provide file path here

bcc.description: Blind Carbon Copy (BCC) recipients' email addresses. Atleast one of cc, bcc, or recipient_email must be provided.
bcc.title: Bcc

cc.description: Carbon Copy (CC) recipients' email addresses. Atleast one of cc, bcc, or recipient_email must be provided.
cc.title: Cc

extra_recipients.description: Additional 'To' recipients' email addresses (not Cc or Bcc). Should only be used if recipient_email is also provided.
extra_recipients.title: Extra Recipients

is_html.description: Indicates if `message_body` is HTML; if True, body must be valid HTML, if False, body should not contain HTML tags.
is_html.title: Is Html

message_body.description: Content of the reply message, either plain text or HTML.
message_body.title: Message Body
examples: Dear Sir, Nice talking to you. Yours respectfully, John

recipient_email.description: Primary recipient's email address. Required if cc and bcc is not provided, else can be optional. Use extra_recipients if you want to send to multiple recipients.
recipient_email.title: Recipient Email

thread_id.description: Identifier of the Gmail thread for the reply.
thread_id.title: Thread Id

user_id.description: Identifier for the user sending the reply; 'me' refers to the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.
historyId.title: History Id

id.description: The immutable ID of the sent message.
id.title: Id

internalDate.description: The internal timestamp of the message in milliseconds since epoch.
internalDate.title: Internal Date

labelIds.description: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.
labelIds.title: Label Ids

payload.description: The parsed email structure, including headers and body parts.
payload.title: Payload

raw.description: The entire email message in RFC 2822 format, base64url-encoded.
raw.title: Raw

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size of the message in bytes.
sizeEstimate.title: Size Estimate

snippet.description: A short extract of the message text.
snippet.title: Snippet

threadId.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.
threadId.title: Thread Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Search People
tools.description: Searches contacts by matching the query against names, nicknames, emails, phone numbers, and organizations, optionally including 'Other Contacts'.

other_contacts.description: When True, searches both saved contacts and 'Other Contacts' (people you've interacted with but not explicitly saved). Note: This restricts person_fields to only 'emailAddresses', 'names', 'phoneNumbers'. When False, searches only saved contacts but allows all person_fields including 'organizations', 'addresses', etc.
other_contacts.title: Other Contacts

pageSize.description: Maximum results to return; values >30 are capped to 30 by the API.
pageSize.title: Page Size

person_fields.description: Comma-separated fields to return (e.g., 'names,emailAddresses'). When 'other_contacts' is true, only 'emailAddresses', 'names', 'phoneNumbers' are allowed. For full field access including 'organizations', set 'other_contacts' to false.
person_fields.title: Person Fields

query.description: Matches contact names, nicknames, email addresses, phone numbers, and organization fields.
query.title: Query

results.description: List of search results, each containing a person record
results.title: Results

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Send Draft
tools.description: Sends the specified, existing draft to the recipients in the To, Cc, and Bcc headers.

draft_id.description: The ID of the draft to send. Make sure that the draft ID is valid and not a placeholder. You can use GMAIL_LIST_DRAFTS or GMAIL_CREATE_EMAIL_DRAFT to get the draft ID, if you don't have it.
draft_id.title: Draft Id

user_id.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.
historyId.title: History Id

id.description: The immutable ID of the sent message.
id.title: Id

internalDate.description: The internal timestamp of the message in milliseconds since epoch.
internalDate.title: Internal Date

labelIds.description: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.
labelIds.title: Label Ids

payload.description: The parsed email structure, including headers and body parts.
payload.title: Payload

raw.description: The entire email message in RFC 2822 format, base64url-encoded.
raw.title: Raw

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size of the message in bytes.
sizeEstimate.title: Size Estimate

snippet.description: A short extract of the message text.
snippet.title: Snippet

threadId.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.
threadId.title: Thread Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Send Email
tools.description: Sends an email via Gmail API using the authenticated user's Google profile display name. At least one of recipient_email, cc, or bcc must be provided. Atleast one of subject or body must be provided. Requires `is_html=True` if the body contains HTML and valid `s3key`, `mimetype`, `name` for any attachment.

attachment.title: FileUploadable
attachment.description: File to attach; ensure `s3key`, `mimetype`, and `name` are set if provided. Omit or set to null for no attachment.

bcc.description: Blind Carbon Copy (BCC) recipients' email addresses. Atleast one of cc, bcc, or recipient_email must be provided.
bcc.title: Bcc

body.description: Email content (plain text or HTML). Either subject or body must be provided for the email to be sent. If HTML, `is_html` must be `True`.
body.title: Body
examples: Hello team, let's discuss the project updates tomorrow.

cc.description: Carbon Copy (CC) recipients' email addresses. Atleast one of cc, bcc, or recipient_email must be provided.
cc.title: Cc

extra_recipients.description: Additional 'To' recipients' email addresses (not Cc or Bcc). Should only be used if recipient_email is also provided.
extra_recipients.title: Extra Recipients

is_html.description: Set to `True` if the email body contains HTML tags.
is_html.title: Is Html

recipient_email.description: Primary recipient's email address. Required if cc and bcc is not provided, else can be optional. Use extra_recipients if you want to send to multiple recipients.
recipient_email.title: Recipient Email

subject.description: Subject line of the email. Either subject or body must be provided for the email to be sent.
subject.title: Subject

user_id.description: User's email address; the literal 'me' refers to the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.
historyId.title: History Id

id.description: The immutable ID of the sent message.
id.title: Id

internalDate.description: The internal timestamp of the message in milliseconds since epoch.
internalDate.title: Internal Date

labelIds.description: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.
labelIds.title: Label Ids

payload.description: The parsed email structure, including headers and body parts.
payload.title: Payload

raw.description: The entire email message in RFC 2822 format, base64url-encoded.
raw.title: Raw

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size of the message in bytes.
sizeEstimate.title: Size Estimate

snippet.description: A short extract of the message text.
snippet.title: Snippet

threadId.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.
threadId.title: Thread Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful
